Specific Details: Access to Leinster House and its environs for those registered under the Regulation of Lobbying Act
DPOs Lobbied: Seán Ó Fearghaíl|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Peter Finnegan|Secretary General|The Houses of the Oireachtas Service::Denis O'Donovan|Senator|Seanad
Subject Matter: Access to Leinster House and its environs for those registered under the Regulation of Lobbying Act
Intended Results: Booking or badging system to be put in place for those registered under the Regulation of Lobbying Act so that they can have access to Leinster House and its environs without the requirement to be signed in by a TD or Senator.::The access rights of former TDs and Senators to Leinster House and its facilities should be reformed. Where former TDs or Senators engage in lobbying activity, their privileged access should be suspended for the duration of that activity. This would be straight forward to implement as such information is publicly disclosed on www.lobbying.ie.  This would not impact on those former members who do not engage in lobbying activities.
Lobbying Activities: Letters to the three ex officio members of the Houses of Oireachtas Commission requesting that the Houses of the Oireachtas Commission adopt our proposals.|Letter|2-5::Tweet directed at the Ceann Comhairle, Seán Ó Fearghaíl TD.|Social Media|1

Specific Details: Following the Parliamentary Forum on Mental Health hosted by the Ceann Comhairle the College offered to work with him to further promote awareness of mental health and illness in society and to discuss how best to support TDs and Senators in this regard. Subject Matter: Following the Parliamentary Forum on Mental Health hosted by the Ceann Comhairle the College offered to work with him to further promote awareness of mental health and illness in society and to discuss how best to support TDs and Senators in this regard. The College is working with the Ceann Comhairle on providing educational, informative and interactive sessions for Oireachtas members and staff to be held in the first quarter of 2018.
Intended Results: Raising awareness and knowledge for Oireachtas members and staff around mental distress, illness, self harm /suicide and relevant & appropriate supports and treatments. Provide other activity of support and education as identified.

Specific Details: Request amendment to Legislation
DPOs Lobbied: Seán Ó Fearghaíl|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Request amendment to Legislation
Intended Results: To raise the viability of services due to the impact of the legislative changes introduced by section 1008A TCA 1997 of the Finance (No. 2) Act 2023. These changes will have a detrimental impact GPCareForAll. The charity runs GP practices in areas of deprivatio; deprived populations do not present an attractive investment proposition for GPs or commercial organisations.We are requesting an urgent amendment to the legislation to exempt charities like GPCareForAll from these provisions.
Lobbying Activities: Meeting on July 16th attended by Kevin Kenny, Austin O'Carroll, Sile Kelly, Amanda Farrelly & Roisin Shortall |Meeting|1::Various emails explaining issue & organising meeting |Email|2-5
